result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory A. Knoblock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:55 am 
INCLUDES 15CF600, 15CF1096, 15CF478, 15CF976, 15TR3303, 15TR3166, 15TR2693, 15TR2694, 15TR3167, 15TR2692, AND 15TR2691. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF600: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1096: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF478: Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF976: Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15TR3303: Ct. 1 (Refusal)>>DEEMED LAWFUL. 
In 15TR3166, 15TR2693, 15TR2694, 15TR3167, 15TR2692, AND 15TR2691>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF600: Amended Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF478: Amended Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>GULTY. 
In 15CF976: Amended Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF600: Amended Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd)>>$1379 inclusive (includes DNA surcharge); DNA sample; 5 days MCJ with 5 days jail credit; 12 month dl revocation with admin credit; 12 month IID - 1/2 priced; AODA; 6 pts against dl. 

In 15CF478: Amended Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>6 years imprisonment w/ 123 days jail credit to run CONCURRENT to 15CF976 - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with E.R., E.R., or D.V; letters of apology to E.R., E.R., and D.V; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution which is to be determined to be paid out of prison wages; CC. 

In 15CF976: Amended Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>6 years imprisonment with 120 days jail credit to run CONCURRENT to 15CF478 - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with E.R., E.R., or D.V; letters of apology to E.R., E.R., and D.V; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution which is to be determined to be paid out of prison wages; CC. 

COURT finds def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Parties to either submit stipulation re: restitution or request restitution hearing as needed. 
COURT remands def into custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 11:15 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 15CF1096 & 15CF976 No contact with victim(s): D.V., 5406 Linda Street in Weston, 5411 Linda Street in Weston, 5407 Linda Street in Weston.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
